section.title: Privacy Considerations
section.t: The Proof of Process framework collects behavioral evidence during content creation. This section addresses the privacy implications of such collection and the mechanisms employed to protect author privacy.

section.title: Data Minimization
section.t: Evidence packets MUST be constructed using the principle of data minimization as defined in . Specifically:

list.t: Keystroke-level timing data MUST be aggregated into statistical summaries (mean, variance, entropy) rather than stored as raw event sequences.
The Attester MUST NOT record the plaintext content of the document being authored. Only cryptographic digests of content state transitions are retained.
Behavioral features MUST be quantized to prevent de-anonymization through stylometric analysis.

section.title: Continuation Token Privacy
section.t: Continuation tokens () link evidence across sessions. To prevent tracking:

list.t: Tokens MUST be derived using HKDF () with a per-session salt.
The Verifier MUST NOT be able to correlate tokens across different documents by the same author.
Token rotation MUST occur at configurable intervals, with a RECOMMENDED maximum of 24 hours.
